alert.note: Alert for Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 10:25PM MDT until March 16 at 9:04AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Utah... Santa Clara River At SANTA CLARA AT ST GEORGE affecting Washington County. .Heavy rain has fallen on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers have increased quickly to reach critical levels. For the Santa Clara...including SANTA CLARA AT ST GEORGE...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Santa Clara River At SANTA CLARA AT ST GEORGE. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.7 feet, At 14.7 ft, developments on the lower Santa Clara River near St. George and the St. George golf course will be threatened. Due to a large engineering effort, the Santa Clara River cannot change its course through St. George. As a result, flood damage is now limited to adjacent roads, bridges, and the St. George golf course. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 17.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 PM MDT Wednesday was 17.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 7.8 feet late Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 13.9 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 915 AM MDT.
